Package org.mcm.sws.process

Provides classes that hold data describin SESMA web service processes and a process execution engine for the automatic execution of such processes.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Activity Abstract superclass of Activities.
AtomicActivity abstract superclass of activities that do not contain (user defined) sub-activities.
Case  
CompoundActivity abstract superclass of activities that DO contain (user defined) sub-activities.
Fork Using a fork node, a thread can be split into multiple parall execution threads
GoalActivity represents an activity that is declaratively specified as a &qout;goal&out; to be reached.
InvokeActivity This activity defines the invokation of a certain web servic operation.
Jump Jump to another specified activitiy.
LocalActivity An activity that is executed locally.
Process This class represents am executable SESMA process.
ProcessInput Input needed for instantiating the process.
ProcessInstance An instance of a SESMA process
ProcessRegistry helper class for process parser
ReceiveActivity not implemented yet
ReplyActivity not implemented yet
Sequence A sequence of activities.
Switch A selection which offers different possible branches depending on the conditions (cases) met.
WaitActivity An atomic activity which suspends the respective branch of the process execution for a given period of time.
WebServiceActivity an abstract superclass for process activities that deal with (the interaction with) web services.
 

Exception Summary
ExecutionException this exception is thrown during process execution if a critical error occurs.
 

Package org.mcm.sws.process Description

Provides classes that hold data describin SESMA web service processes and a process execution engine for the automatic execution of such processes.
